alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 17 at 3:32PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Extreme Cold Temperatures Arrive Late This Weekend... Well below normal temperatures and strong northerly winds across the panhandle area continuing into Sunday. As Arctic air funnels into the panhandle, temperatures will steadily decrease through early next week with the coldest temperatures expected Monday and Tuesday. Consistent wind chills below zero are expected beginning Saturday and continuing through Tuesday for the northern panhandle while the southern panhandle sees single digits. Near record temperatures are possible as daytime highs are expected to fall into the single digits across the north and low teens across the south. Additionally, overnight lows will fall below zero. There is even the potential that daytime high temperatures could remain below zero for some communities across the northern panhandle that are wind protected. Now is the time to take action and begin preparation for these cold temperatures. Remember to take appropriate safety measures when outdoors. Be mindful of your plumbing and the welfare of your pets, neighbors, and friends.
